original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close down, banking shares attract retail interest
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed down on Tuesday, data on its site showed.
The All Share Price Index was down 0.29 percent, or 30.72 points, at 10,719.
The S&P SL20 index was down 0.33 percent, or 10.04 points, at 3,072.
Turnover was low at 517 million. A big portion of this came from trades in the banking industry, followed closely by the food, beverage and tobacco industry.
Cargills Bank Limited, which started trading today, was the most traded and closed up at 8.10.
Top positive contributors to the ASPI were DFCC Bank Plc (up at 79.00), Browns Investments Plc (up at 4.60) LOLC Finance Plc (up at 4.80).
The foreign outflow continued with today registering 40 million. (Colombo/Jan5/2024).
